JobFullDesc:
Construction affects the lives of nearly everyone in the world. It’s a $10T global industry, employing 7% of the world’s population. However, it’s also one of the world’s least digitized industries. Construction is in need of transformation, and Procore is right at the forefront. Will you join our journey?
With 5+ acquisitions in the last 3 years, over 10,000 customers, and a growing international footprint, we’re looking for a Corporate Accounting M&A Manager to drive strategic initiatives, focusing on M&A activities, and join Procore’s journey to revolutionize a historically underserved industry. You’ll be a key contributor to Procore’s Corporate Development and M&A, driving financial and accounting due diligence and providing target assessments and thought leadership to enable well-informed M&A decisions at all levels of the organization. As the Corporate Accounting M&A Manager, you’ll own pre-close financial and accounting due diligence and analysis, communicate risks and recommendations, and advise on sales and purchase agreements. You will also own post-acquisition purchase accounting assessments, draft technical accounting memos, and provide input on post acquisition integration planning and execution for the department.
This role will directly report to the Director of Technical Accounting and Financial Reporting and will be based in our Austin or Carpinteria offices. Remote candidates will be considered. We’re looking for someone to join us immediately.
What you’ll do: 

Conduct financial and accounting due diligence, including customer contracts, terms and conditions, and expansion/cancellation trends, and provide assessments of a target company’s outlook, financial profile, strategic fit, and synergy potential, informing both deal-level decision making and Procore’s broader M&A strategy.
Perform comprehensive research and analysis, synthesize inputs, develop unbiased point of view, and make recommendations on critical issues, potential risks, and “deal breakers” for a potential acquisition
Evaluate targets’ historical and projected earnings and cash flows; hidden contingencies, commitments, as well as quality of assets and internal control structure
Assist in structuring purchase price adjustment mechanisms (i.e., setting working capital peg) and other relevant projections in purchase agreements and conduct post-acquisition closing net working capital adjustment analysis
Support post-acquisition integration efforts, and help the team further refine overall M&A strategy, improve the due diligence process, and constantly iterate on integration planning and execution
Draft technical acquisition accounting memo, assist in intangibles valuation, and propose journal entries  

 
What we’re looking for: 

CPA licensed, with a Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Accounting, or Finance
At least 5 years of US GAAP Accounting experience, with strong technical accounting knowledge and a deep understanding of the new revenue recognition standard ASC 606 and business combinations standard ASC 805
SaaS industry experience and preferred. Audit experience with a large public accounting firm preferred
Proven experience with financial modeling, valuation, and M&A transactions
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to present diligence findings to leadership teams in a clear, concise manner
Strong financial, research and analytical skills with ability to assimilate and analyze data, extract insights, and make informed recommendations  

About UsProcore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes, and more.
